BackEnd

Class Gameboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • BackEnd.Gameboard

  • public class Gameboard
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the Gameboard and all of its workings. It is by far the most complicated class in the project. It deals with the sliding of the floor tiles, the placement of the fixed tiles, the placement of action tiles and their radii, the movement of player pieces, and the location of tiles on the gameboard.
    Author:
    Joshua Oladitan, Atif Ishaq and Christian Sanger.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Gameboard

        public Gameboard(int width,
                 int height,
                 SilkBag silkBag)
        This constructor of Gameboard initializes all of the attributes, save the removedTile, which gets initialized in playFloorTile. It takes in the width, and height of the Gameboard, as well as the SilkBag that the board is connected to.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the gameboard.
        height - The height of the gameboard.
        silkBag - The SilkBag that this gameboard is connected to.

                                   int history)

        Parameters:

        history - How many turns ago we want to know the player's position.
        Returns:

      • playFloorTile

        public void playFloorTile(Coordinate location,
                          FloorTile insertedTile)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This method plays a floorTile in a given row/column, and moves every floorTile in that direction, if it isn't fixed or frozen. Once a floorTile is inserted, the tile that is on the end is placed into the SilkBag, and the player piece that is on the end is now placed on the newly inserted tile. Inserting from the left is denoted as selecting a location with a x-coordinate of -1, inserting from the bottom is denoted as selecting a location with a y-coordinate of -1, inserting from the right is denoted as selecting a location with a y-coordinate of the width of the board, and inserting from the top is denoted as selecting a location with a y-coordinate of the height of the board.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the given side to slide in the floorTile from.
        insertedTile - The floorTile to slide into that location.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getMoveDirections

        public java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> getMoveDirections(int player)
        This method returns the move directions a player could possible move in as an arrayList for the specified player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player whose move directions is to be obtained.
        Returns:
        moveLocations The move directions for the specified player.

      • playActionTile

        public void playActionTile(Coordinate location,
                           ActionTile tile,
                           int player)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This function is used to play action tiles depending on the action tile given.
        Parameters:
        location - to use action tile
        tile - type of action tile
        player - refers to the player that's using the tile.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

                           Coordinate location)
        Places a fixed floor tile and board tile in the coordinates specified.
        Parameters:
        tile - to be placed
        location - this is the coordinate for the location.

        public java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> checkGoalTiles()
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks the board for goal tiles, adds the coordinates to the ArrayList.
        Returns:
        the ArrayList of goal tile locations.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • isPlayerOnGoal

        public int isPlayerOnGoal()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks to see if a player is on goal by going through all the players' locations to see if they match the goal coordinates.
        Returns:
        if a player coordinate matches a goal coordinate, return true, else false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setFireCoords

        public void setFireCoords(Coordinate location)
        This method sets fire in a 3x3 radius to the given coordinates. Making sure that the tiles its setting fire to are on the board.
        Parameters:
        location - the 3x3 area to set fire to.

      • setFreezeCoords

        public void setFreezeCoords(Coordinate location)
        This method freezes in a 3x3 radius to the given coordinates. Making sure that the tiles its getting froze to are on the board.
        Parameters:
        location - the 3x3 area to freeze.

      • getSlideLocations

        public java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> getSlideLocations()
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This method gets the slide locations that a player can play a floor tile. It does this by checking every row/column and checking if there is a fixed tile in that row/column. If there isnt add it to the slide locations.
        Returns:
        the ArrayList of slide locations.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • backtrack

        public void backtrack(int player)
        This method check the players previous two locations, if the player has moved one or more times and the previous location is not on fire and there is not a player on that tile. Then backtrack is valid. The player will move back one or two positions if backtrack is played on the player.
        Parameters:
        player -

      • isBoardNotFull

        public boolean isBoardNotFull()
        This method goes through the board width and height checking the tiles to see if any of them are null (they dont contain a tile). If at least one tile doesn't contain a tile return true.
        Returns:
        true, if there is a null location on the board. Else false.

      • setNumOfPlayers

        public void setNumOfPlayers(int numOfPlayers)
        Sets the number of players in the game
        Parameters:
        numOfPlayers - the number of players

      • getNumOfPlayers

        public int getNumOfPlayers()
        This method gets the number of players by checking the playerLocations array. Incrementing the number of players if the array is not equal to null.
        Returns:
        the number of players.

      • ticTiles

        public void ticTiles()
              throws java.lang.Exception
        This method ticks all the given tiles, to remove their affect.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception if null.

                           int x,

        This method places a fixed tile to the given location.
        Parameters:
        floorTile - The tile to be fixed.
        x - x coordinate.
        y - y coordinate.
